raw_comment:
Notice: I definitely notice a strong absence of head coaches that are POC. Unsurprising really that there is almost always going to be at least double the number of POC players than head coaches.

Wonder: I wonder how big their sample size is and what the numbers really are. I also wonder what each association plans on doing to change this because it really should be more correlated. 

This may not have a great impact on my immediate community, but I am from Iowa so a couple of our college teams are kinda good I guess. It mainly has an impact on the players of color who I feel for because they are more than likely to not see a coach who is also POC during their career (throughout college athletics and throughout their career if they choose that path). 

Possible Headline: Broken Promises: National Athletics Associations Refuse To Level With Their Commitments to Racial Equity.
ace_sentences: I notice an absence of head coaches who are persons of color.
It is unsurprising that the number of players who are persons of color is at least double the number of head coaches who are persons of color.
I wonder how big the sample size is.
I wonder what the numbers are.
I wonder what each association plans to do to change this situation.
The number of players who are persons of color should correlate with the number of head coaches who are persons of color.
This situation may not have a great impact on my immediate community.
Some college teams in Iowa are good.
This situation mainly affects players of color.
Many players of color will not see a head coach who is a person of color during their college athletic career.
Many players of color will not see a head coach who is a person of color during their professional athletic career if they choose that path.
The headline is: Broken Promises: National Athletics Associations Refuse To Level With Their Commitments to Racial Equity.
